div.p:
not
Shakspeare, but only Master William Shak-
speare of the shrewd, thriving, business firm
of Condell, Shakspeare & Co., proprietors of the
Globe Theatre in London; and by a courtly
author, of the name of Chettle, was looked at
as an "upstart crow," beautified "with other
birds' feathers." For, mark it well, imitation
is often the first charge brought against real
originality. Why this is so, there is not space
